clinicalDescription: Overview: A blockage of an artery in the lungs by a substance that has moved from elsewhere in the body through the bloodstream (embolism). Blood clot in the lungs. PEs are most often caused by DVTs (deep vein thrombosis)Presentation: Sudden shortness of breath and chest pain. Depends on the size of the clot and where it lodges in the lung.Assessment: V/Q scan, CXR, EKG, CT or MRI (lungs), pulmonary angiography, Blood tests (including the D-dimer test)Plan: Anticouagulants, thrombolytics. vein filter (interventional procedure) or surgery Prognosis: Prompt treatment to break up the clot greatly reduces the risk of death. High mortality if untreated. Can be fatal.
